comments.content: That'd probably easier with the source and for this case, the website...
Thanks. In this case this title is set as an image, not as CSS.
A bigger screen shot would help

> Thanks. In this case this title is set as an image, not as CSS.

Of course, it's a graphic! Thanks for this very constructive feedback...  
Look, for the moment, I'm the only one that answered. I'm here to help (you in this case) but your answer makes me thinking you don't need it. Providing source helps, a lot, really... It could provide more samples (better quality, larger...), PDF, SWF... with earmarked letters that made the search possible.
Trade Gothic and News Gothic are both close

Not sure if this is better but here is another image of the same font (I think):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823040848im_/http:/typophile.com/files/dropdown_simul_habitOn_5385.gif)
  
I don't have any other source except for the website:  
 [http://www.creditoagricola.pt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823040848/http:/www.creditoagricola.pt/ "http://www.creditoagricola.pt/")  
There are some pdf's there but I opened several and they only included images and they didn't seem to be bigger.  
Thanks for your assistance Ryuk. I am sorry if I did not sound helpful but I though you were suggesting inspecting the code for the website. Sorry.
The typeface is Centima Regular by TipografiaRamis, a font foundry established in 2004 by Ramiz Guseynov.

Thanks for the link. Now, I can say it's [Centima](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823040848/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/tipografiaramis/centima) confirmed among all by this [PDF](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823040848/http:/www.creditoagricola.pt/NR/rdonlyres/C892924D-46DE-4B23-8E4C-E714421F875A/0/CANoticiasEmp_JUN12.pdf).

Ryuk: The Acrobat front properties panel says for the above linked PDF are Flama Sans

[http://www.felicianotypefoundry.com/cms/fonts/flama](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823040848/http:/www.felicianotypefoundry.com/cms/fonts/flama "http://www.felicianotypefoundry.com/cms/fonts/flama")

My bad! Thanks bojev for being vigilant. I found the PDF stating it's [Flama Semi Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823040848/http:/vllg.com/Feliciano/Flama_Semicondensed) then saw answer of kthomps5 saying it was Centima and mixed the whole thing up... Really sorry for the mess... Now that's clear, I confirm it's Flama Semi Condensed.
Sorry, Ryuk--Centima was the best match I could get from the small graphics you supplied. Glad someone else searched out the PDFs and got a definitive answer for you.
